adjectives.description: nurturant (comparative more nurturant, superlative most nurturant)

examples: In other words, liberalism defines government as tyrant father but demands it behave as nurturant mother.

entries.meaning: That which nurtures; a nurturing factor or influence.
examples: By removing one or another aspect from an organism's visual environment, one can determine the essential visual nurturants. The latter are then considered the basic visual-environmental determinants of the development of visual perception.
